content:
🧬 NGS Read Simulator: Synthetic Sequencing Data Generation

Generate Realistic Synthetic Sequencing Reads for Testing and Benchmarking

The NGS Read Simulator pipeline uses ART (Artificial Read Technology) to generate high-quality synthetic Illumina sequencing reads that accurately mimic real sequencing data. Create custom datasets for pipeline validation, method benchmarking, and bioinformatics tool development without the cost and time of actual sequencing.

🎯 Simulation Modes

Choose the optimal simulation mode for your experimental design:

🧪 Amplicon Sequencing

  • 📊 PCR products: Simulate targeted amplicon sequencing (16S rRNA, viral genomes, gene panels)

  • 🎯 Variable coverage: Control read depth per amplicon for realistic heterogeneity

  • ✅ Best for: Microbiome studies, viral diagnostics, targeted gene sequencing

🎯 Target Capture (Enrichment)

  • 🧬 Exome sequencing: Simulate hybrid capture and target enrichment protocols

  • 📋 Custom bait sets: Define specific genomic regions for capture simulation

  • ✅ Best for: Whole exome sequencing (WES), clinical gene panels, custom capture designs

🦠 Metagenome Sequencing

  • 🌍 Community profiling: Simulate complex microbial communities with multiple species

  • ⚖️ Abundance control: Set relative abundances for each species in the community

  • ✅ Best for: Microbiome research, environmental sequencing, pathogen detection

🧬 Whole Genome Sequencing (WGS)

  • 📊 Complete coverage: Simulate uniform or variable coverage across entire genomes

  • 🔬 Multiple organisms: Any reference genome with FASTA sequence

  • ✅ Best for: Genome assembly validation, variant calling benchmarks, de novo sequencing

⚙️ Advanced Simulation Features

Sequencing Parameters

  • 📏 Read length: Configurable read lengths (50-300bp typical for Illumina)

  • 📐 Fragment size: Control DNA/RNA fragment size distribution (mean and standard deviation)

  • 🔄 Paired-end or single-end: Generate PE reads (fragment <2000bp) or mate-pair (≥2000bp)

  • 📊 Coverage depth: Specify total read count or coverage per amplicon/region

Quality and Error Models

  • 📈 Empirical error profiles: Built-in quality profiles from real Illumina sequencers (HiSeq, NovaSeq, etc.)

  • 🎲 Realistic errors: Accurate simulation of sequencing errors, base quality scores, and artifacts

  • 🔧 Custom profiles: Use your own error models from recalibrated sequencing data

📋 Sample Sheet Format

Your CSV samplesheet defines the simulation experiments:

Amplicon Mode:

sample,seed
amplicon_sample1,12345
amplicon_sample2,67890

Whole Genome Mode:

sample,seed
genome_sample1,11111
genome_sample2,22222

Note: The seed parameter ensures reproducible simulations - same seed generates identical reads.

🎯 Use Cases and Applications

Pipeline Validation

  • 🔍 Truth sets: Generate reads with known variants, insertions, or rearrangements

  • ✅ Benchmarking: Test alignment accuracy, variant calling sensitivity/specificity

  • 📊 Performance testing: Evaluate computational requirements with controlled datasets

Method Development

  • 🧪 Algorithm testing: Develop and validate new bioinformatics methods

  • 📈 Statistical power: Determine required sequencing depth for specific applications

  • 🎓 Training data: Generate synthetic datasets for machine learning models

Educational Applications

  • 📚 Teaching: Provide reproducible datasets for bioinformatics courses

  • 🎯 Workflow demonstrations: Show analysis pipelines without expensive sequencing

  • 🔬 Protocol optimization: Test experimental designs before committing resources

📊 Output Files

Simulated Reads

  • 📄 FASTQ files: Standard format compatible with all downstream tools

  • 🔢 Paired-end: *_1.fq.gz and *_2.fq.gz for forward and reverse reads

  • 📊 Quality scores: Realistic Phred quality scores matching empirical distributions

Alignment Information

  • 📋 ALN files: Ground truth alignment positions for validation

  • 🎯 SAM format: Optional alignment output for immediate analysis

Quality Control

  • 📈 MultiQC Report: Comprehensive summary of simulation statistics

  • 📊 Coverage metrics: Per-base and per-region coverage distributions

  • 🔍 Quality summaries: Read length distribution, quality score profiles

🔬 Technical Specifications

ART Illumina Simulator

  • ⚡ High performance: C++ implementation with optimized algorithms

  • 🎯 Accurate modeling: Empirical error models from large-scale sequencing studies

  • 🔧 Flexible configuration: Extensive parameters for fine-tuning simulations

Supported Platforms

  • Illumina: HiSeq, NovaSeq, MiSeq, NextSeq (various read lengths and chemistries)

  • Quality profiles: Pre-configured profiles for common sequencing platforms

  • Custom profiles: Import your own quality profiles for specialized applications

💡 Key Benefits

  • 💰 Cost-effective: Generate unlimited test data without sequencing costs

  • ⏱️ Fast iteration: Quickly test multiple scenarios and parameters

  • 🎯 Reproducible: Seed-based generation ensures identical results

  • ✅ Ground truth: Know exact read origins for validation

  • 🔧 Customizable: Control every aspect of the simulation

  • 📊 Realistic: Empirical error models match real sequencing data

Perfect for: Bioinformatics tool development • Pipeline benchmarking • Method validation • Algorithm testing • Educational purposes • Protocol optimization • Statistical power analysis • Quality control testing

Built with Nextflow • Powered by nf-core/readsimulator v1.0.1 • ART Illumina Simulator • Containerized execution • Reproducible simulations
